Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content:
I've given up on trying to recover this account. If anyone wants to attempt to recover 5.00010005KMD here's the information. You can keep the KMD obviously but I wouldn't mind knowing how it was done. The following produced that address only once after initial account setup.

Komodo

Seed words
search six super idea fiction speed impact change aware photo bamboo rookie satoshi much domain mandate ability flame immune donkey humble miss poem client

Seed Encrypt Key (PIN)
fhj489jbcJLKJGFG8975rrFHBJfdfgFDSW345yffghhxfghjxfhxg547854

New Safe Address - RPVRttmUM8dVebFWV6vZvh6hzKf2GF7EEz

The old compromised address which is accessible had the following setup information and shows the dust being sent to this address.

Agama (Komodo)

Seed:
idle saddle scale advice super dress uncle waste ensure next car empty aspect cruise flower party omit swarm tackle wish jacket muscle warfare defy

Public Address:
R9ngK4u9HXocykUU4LVwj4LdQvrJb4paDh

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: The address handling by agama is abysmal. I won't be trusting it anytime soon and that's only  one of a number of problems I came across in 3 days  of messing about with the wallet. I like Komodo but jeeeez.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @TheFalseProfit i have about 50 different seeds and in the last about 2 years Agama never generated a wrong address as long as i had the seed correct.

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: Main lesson learnt = Get WIF straight away. ONLY reliable way to get an address back.

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content:
Yes, well I've produced it a number of times on two computers and others have complained of the same thing. The trouble is it only happens now and again and I'm out of time and patience to do the 10 odd screenshots over and over until it reproduces. 

It may have something to do with going in with the new seed first time, but second time going in with the password. At which point the second address may stick, or they both produce different address's, or other variations. It's intermittent. I'm past caring.

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Regarding this :-

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: you can use bootstrap for qt: https://dexstats.info/bootstrap.php place it extracted in the same folder as komodo.conf

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: I'm still not getting anywhere using oceanQT. Is there anything that need deleting perhaps?

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: PS I'm using Linux.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what is your actual issue?

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: I'm trying to load the BC from the bootstrap file using oceanQT

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: I have extracted it and placed it in the same folder as komodo.conf

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: did it not work?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what is your actual issue now after extracting bootstrap data inside data dir?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: did you start KomodoOceanQT wallet after extracting bootstrap?

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Yes, of course, it's just stuck on "syncing headers"

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Do I need to make "chainstate" and "blocks" on the root of the data directory as opposed to "KMD-bootstrap"??

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes, they should be in root dir `~/.komodo` as where the `komodo.conf` file is and not inside `KMD-bootstrap` dir

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
`I have extracted it and placed it in the same folder as komodo.conf`
you mentioned that you have already done it

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: But my komodo.conf is not in the hidden .komodo dir. It's where I originally extracted it.

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: OK, theres an existing .komodo from my agama installation. Guessing the new wallet decided to leave it intact.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: ok. seems you are confused. there shouldn't be any `KMD-bootstrap` dir. copy all contents from KMD-bootstrap dir and paste them in `.komodo` dir

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: can you do that?

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Shall I just completely wipe the old .komodo > place bootstrap there > restart?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: stop KomodoOceanQT before

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Yep, will do.

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: Shall I just nuke the existing .komodo dir first though??

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: there is no need

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: ok

Author: TimTim#2040
Content: @SHossain , ok thanks man, we have lift off. Basically I was told to use the same dir as komodo.conf. Unfortunately that appears BOTH in the hidden and the same working dir the qt is extracted to. I picked the wrong one I guess. Anyway, all ok now, thanks again!!

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: glad that your issue is sorted
